Vulnerability.Title: firstboot bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The firstboot utility runs after system installation and guides the user through a series of steps that allows for easier configuration of the machine. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the firstboot systemd service stayed enabled after the firstboot process was completed. This, in consequence, slowed down every system boot by about 400 ms. With this update, the firstboot service is now properly disabled once the firstboot process is completed, and the described slowdown no longer occurs. (BZ#1091317) The firstboot utility requires the python-ethtool package, but python-ethtool was not declared as a dependency in the firstboot package. As a consequence, the firstboot utility could not be started successfully if python-ethtool was not installed. This bug has been fixed, and python-ethtool is now correctly pulled in when the firstboot package is installed. (BZ#1116921) Previously, the title layout did not accommodate long titles in the firstboot window. Consequently, certain translated titles did not fit in the window and were disrupted. This bug has been fixed, and long titles are no longer disrupted. (BZ#1040583) Prior to this update, the exception handler in the firstboot utility did not work correctly. Consequently, crashes in firstboot could not be properly reported. A patch has been applied, and firstboot crashes are now successfully reported by Automatic Bug Reporting Tool (ABRT). (BZ#952633) Users of firstboot are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
